titleproper.value:
Guide to the Papers of Frances Patai
                    <num>ALBA.131</num>

author.value: Finding aid prepared by Angela Frattarola and Ted Casselman

creation.value:
This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit
                <date>2012-03-28T16:44-0400</date>

abstract.label: Abstract
abstract.value:
Frances Patai was an educator, writer, historian and feminist activist. Born in New York in 1930 she earned her bachelors and masters degrees at the City College of New York in the 1950s and taught English and communication courses throughout the City University of New York (CUNY) system. Throughout her career Patai was concerned with the rights and status of women, and in the last decade of her life she devoted her efforts to researching and writing a book on women medical personnel who volunteered during the Spanish Civil War. Patai died in 1998 before she could bring her project to fruition. She was 67 years old. The Patai Papers consist predominantly of research materials she gathered and drafts she produced during the course of her work on her unpublished book, 
                <title render="italic">Heroines of the Good Fight: U.S. Women Volunteers in the Spanish Civil War</title>including articles, clippings, and notes.

p.value:
Published citations should take the following form: 
                <lb/>
                <lb/>Identification of item, date; Collection name; Collection number; box number; folder number; 
                <lb/>Tamiment Library/Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives 
                <lb/>Elmer Holmes Bobst Library 
                <lb/>70 Washington Square South 
                <lb/>New York, NY 10012, New York University Libraries.

<list>
                    <item>Rimmel, Leslie, "Frances (Francesca) Patai, 1930-1998," 
                        <title render="italic">Off Our Backs</title>(Washington), April 1998.</item>
                    <item>Leberstein, Stephen, "Eloquence of Former Chancellor Sparks Major CCNY Bequest," 
                        <title render="italic">CUNY Matters</title>, Spring 1998.</item>
                </list>

Series III: This series is made up of subject files. Included here are notes, excerpt from publications, and research materials on general topics, organizations, and individuals as well as biographical material on Patai. Notable among these files are copies of Jirku Gusti's, "We Fight Death," and Sandor Voros' unpublished manuscript on hospitals and medical services.

corpname.value: Spain. Ejercito Popular de la Republica. Abraham Lincoln Battalion.

                <c02 id="ref74" level="otherlevel">
